It is characterized by its distinctive, metallic-green fronds that give it its common name. This fern thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, Grammatopteridium ferreum is considered a valuable indicator species for ecological health.
